intro: Spilanthes limonica, commonly known as the Mexican toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in dense clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branched. Spilanthes limonica is known for its medicinal properties, particularly for its ability to alleviate toothache and other oral discomforts.
